intro: Elaeoselinum loscosii, commonly known as the Canary Islands rock samphire, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, fern-like foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. It produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Elaeoselinum loscosii is known for its resilience and is often used in local landscaping due to its hardy nature and ornamental value.
